ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Proportion of trials where the participant responded quickly enough to earn the reward when the reward was 0 stars
Proportion of trials where the participant did not respond quickly enough (or responded before the response period began) to earn the reward when the reward was 0 stars
Reaction time for trials where the reward was 0 stars
Proportion of trials where the participant responded quickly enough to earn the reward when the reward was 1 star
Proportion of trials where the participant did not respond quickly enough (or responded before the response period began) to earn the reward when the reward was 1 star1
Reaction time for trials where the reward was 1 star
Proportion of trials where the participant responded quickly enough to earn the reward when the reward was 2 stars
Proportion of trials where the participant did not respond quickly enough (or responded before the response period began) to earn the reward when the reward was 2 stars
Reaction time for trials where the reward was 2 stars
Proportion of trials where the participant responded quickly enough to earn the reward when the reward was 4 stars
Proportion of trials where the participant did not respond quickly enough (or responded before the response period began) to earn the reward when the reward was 4 stars
Reaction time for trials where the reward was 4 stars
